articles.title: Choe Yong Rim on Development of Agricultural Science
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim on Development of Agricultural Science
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim acquainted himself with the work of the Academy of Agricultural Science on the spot on March 25.
					 After looking round various places including the Agricultural Science Exhibition, he held a consultative meeting of officials concerned.
					
					 The meeting stressed in particular that it is necessary to give priority to the development of agricultural science and technology in order to bring about great innovations in agricultural production as intended by the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 It discussed the issues of breeding more high-yielding species suited to the climate and soil conditions of the country and took measures to provide the scientists and researchers with ample conditions for their work.
					
					 Choe went round the Indoor Swimming Pool in Chongchun Street on the same day and discussed the issues of improving its management and operation and took measures to do so.

articles.title: Inter-Korean Contact for Joint Study of Volcano of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Inter-Korean Contact for Joint Study of Volcano of Mt. Paektu
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- An inter-Korean working contact for joint study of the volcano of Mt. Paektu was held in Munsan of south Korea on Tuesday.
					 At the contact the north and the south sides shared the view that it is needed to make a joint study of the volcano activities on Mt. Paektu. They agreed to positively cooperate with each other and continue the discussion on concrete issues related to the joint study in the future.
					
					 They also agreed to have the next contact in early April.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Arrives in London
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Arrives in London
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, and his party arrived in London on Sunday to visit UK.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Mongolian Presidential Envoy
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Mongolian Presidential Envoy 
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, had a  talk with L. Purevsuren, foreign policy advisor to the president of Mongolia who is presidential envoy, and his party Tuesday when they paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Personal Letter and Gift from Mongolian President
articles.content:
Personal Letter and Gift from Mongolian President
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received the personal letter and a gift from President of Mongolia Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj.
					 L. Purevsuren, foreign policy advisor to the president of Mongolia who is presidential envoy on a visit to the DPRK, handed the personal letter and gift over to Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Tuesday.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Mongolian Presidential Envoy
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Mongolian Presidential Envoy
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun Tuesday met and had a talk with L. Purevsuren, foreign policy advisor to the president of Mongolia who is presidential envoy, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Korean People's Achievements Lauded by Cambodian King
articles.content:
Korean People's Achievements Lauded by Cambodian King 
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni met and had a friendly talk with the visiting military delegation of the Korean People's Army led by Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, at the Royal Palace on Monday.
					 The Cambodian people will always remember the support rendered by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il to Cambodia, the king said.
					
					 He gave a high appreciation of the achievements made by the friendly Korean people under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Cambodian Leaders Meet KPA Military Delegation
articles.content:
Cambodian Leaders Meet KPA Military Delegation
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Prime Minister of Cambodia Hun Sen met and had a talk with the visiting military delegation of the Korean People's Army headed by Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, at the government building on Monday.
					 He referred to many achievements made by the Korean people in building a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He expressed belief that the relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields in the future, too.

articles.title: KPA Military Delegation Meets Cambodian Defense Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
KPA Military Delegation Meets Cambodian Defense Ministry Delegation
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Talks between the military delegation of the Korean People's Army and the delegation of the Cambodian Ministry of Defense were held at the building of the ministry on Monday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were the members of the military delegation led by Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and the DPRK ambassador to Cambodia and from the Cambodian side the advisor to the minister of Defense  and the director general for policies and foreign relations and other officials of the ministry.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of further developing the friendly relations between the armies of the two countries and other issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Delegation of CBCK Leaves for China
articles.content:
Delegation of CBCK Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Central Broadcasting Committee of Korea led by its Vice-Chairman Ri Chol left here today for China.

articles.title: Gift from Federal Emigration Bureau of Russia
articles.content:
Gift from Federal Emigration Bureau of Russia
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented on Tuesday with a gift by the Federal Emigration Bureau of Russia.
					 Vice-Director Anatoli Kuznetsov on a visit to the DPRK handed the gift to an official concerned.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Federal Emigration Bureau of Russia led by Vice-Director Anatoli Kuznetsov visited the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill Tuesday to pay homage to him.
					 It laid bouquets before the statue and made bows to the statue in humble reverence for the President who made immortal contribution to the strengthening of the DPRK-Russia friendship.

articles.title: Participants of Songun Active Sports Person's Meeting Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Participants of Songun Active Sports Person's Meeting Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The participants of the meeting of active sports persons of Songun visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace Tuesday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.
					 They paid homage in profound reverence to the President, looking back on his exploits shining along with the development of the Juche-oriented sports.

articles.title: Emblem of World Taekwon-Do Championship Opened to Public
articles.content:
Emblem of World Taekwon-Do Championship Opened to Public
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The emblem of the 17th World Taekwon-Do Championship was opened to the public recently.
					 Seen in the emblem are the DPRK flag, the abbreviated name of the International Taekwon-Do Federation and the Taekwon-Do Hall.
					
					 The championship will be held in Pyongyang from September 6 to 12. The capital of the DPRK sponsored the 8th championship.

articles.title: Greening Campaign in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Greening Campaign in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A greening campaign is taking place in Pyongyang.
					 Roadside trees along the Ponghwa Street are being replaced with trees of good species.
					
					 On the roadside lawns, flowering plants are being planted in the front and such ever-green trees as thuja and juniper in the rear to present a three-dimensional effect.
					
					 The median islands of the Hyoksin, Kwangbok and other streets are also garnished with plants.
					
					 Nurseries under the Ministry of Urban Management, Pyongyang City Greening Company and district horticultural stations supply trees and flowering plants of good species.
					
					 Horticultural scientists and technicians are also playing an important part in the campaign.
					
					 A nation-wide campaign for land management is conducted in the country in every spring.

articles.title: Hydroponic Greenhouse
articles.content:
Hydroponic Greenhouse 
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- There is a hydroponic greenhouse in the Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute.
					 Cultivated in the greenhouse are tomato, cucumber, capsicum, egg apple, white spring radish and other nutritive vegetables.
					
					 The greenhouse with several conical roofs is walled with glass to make the utmost use of solar heat.
					
					 All the processes ranging from manuring to the adjustment of temperature and humidity are controlled by computer.
					
					 The greenhouse not only produces vegetables but also serves as a research center.

articles.title: Rason Economic, Trade Zone
articles.content:
Rason Economic, Trade Zone
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The Rason economic and trade zone of the DPRK will turn into a major entrepot, exports producer and financial and tourist zone of Northeast Asia, said an official of the Rason City People's Committee.
					 Hwang Chol Nam, vice-chairman of the committee, told KCNA the city is a special economic zone involving preferential trade, investment, intermediary transport, finance, tourism and services.
					
					 The DPRK government protects by law foreigners' investment, legitimate income and rights.
					
					 Foreign investors and businesses are allowed to conduct diverse economic and trade activities and have a free choice of investment forms and business methods in the zone.

articles.title: Korean Food and Eating Habits
articles.content:
Korean Food and Eating Habits
						
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Korean food is appetizing, tasty, nourishing and digestible. 
					 The Korean food is diverse in kind and peculiar in color and shape.
					
					 From long time ago, the Korean people have developed national dishes with land and sea materials to suit their taste.
					
					 They have also created cooking and table-setting methods, table manners and eating habits peculiar to the nation.
					
					 The government has always paid deep attention to steadily improving the Korean food and eating habits.

articles.title: Xigang Meeting
articles.content:
Xigang Meeting 
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Seventy-four years has elapsed since President Kim Il Sung convened the Xigang meeting on March 29, Juche 26 (1937).
					 At the meeting, the President reiterated his strong will to achieve the country's liberation by force of arms.
					
					 In the latter half of the 1930s, the Japanese imperialists were focusing all means on obliterating the soul of the Korean nation, while strengthening the defenses of border areas along the Rivers Amnok and Tuman.
					
					 Such being the situation, nobody imagined that units of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) would advance into the homeland.
					
					 Basing himself on a scientific analysis of the situation, the President put forth a policy of advancing large units of the KPRA into the homeland to let the local people believe that Korea would surely be liberated as long as the KPRA exists.
					
					 He ordered the units to march in three directions and indicated the missions and operation theatres of each unit.
					
					 The policy was aimed to inspire the local people with confidence in the country's liberation and rapidly expand the anti-Japanese armed struggle deep into the homeland.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Persistently Talking about "Sincerity"
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Persistently Talking about "Sincerity" 
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The vice-minister of Unification of south Korea, addressing a recent "general meeting of the consultative council of businesses in Kaesong Industrial Zone", again cried out for what he called "change in the north's attitude." He said the inter-Korean relations can make progress only when the north "makes apology for exploding 'Cheonan' warship and makes assurances against the reoccurrence of the similar case."
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a signed commentary observes in this regard:
					
					 What he uttered is nothing but a far-fetched assertion of the provocateurs because it betrays the anti-reunification scenario to keep the door of inter-Korean dialogue indefinitely closed, while raising the insolvable issues as preconditions.
					
					 The "Cheonan" case was, to all intents and purposes, a conspiratorial farce orchestrated by the south Korean warmongers in a bid to hamstring the DPRK's repeated efforts for dialogue and escalate the confrontation and thus do harm to it.
					
					 They are blocking their oft-repeated dialogue by themselves while unreasonably insisting on the north's "change in its attitude" and "sincerity." 
					
					 They are rejecting dialogue while vociferating about "responsible steps" over the "Cheonan" case. This only goes to prove that they are not willing to have dialogue or improve relations with the north but are steeped only in the enmity toward it and intention to escalate confrontation with it.
					
					  It is high time they stopped talking about "change in attitude" and "sincerity" for the sake of improved inter-Korean relations as this kind of wordplay is too tedious to hear and no longer workable.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, it is the south Korean authorities who should change their attitude and make a switchover in their policy. 
					
					 They would be well advised to stop such foolish act as misleading public opinion and laying an obstacle in the way of dialogue and act with reason.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Adhering to Independence
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Adhering to Independence
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Now the world political situation and the trend of the international relations urgently require every country to adhere to independence, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a bylined article.
					 If every country and nation is to exercise their sovereignty, they should pursue an independent policy in external relations, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 When a country blindly meets the demand of a big country and follows its policy, failing to maintain its independent stand in relations with other countries, it cannot protect its national interests and sovereignty but will be bound to meet the grave consequences of inviting domination and subjugation. 
					
					 It is the way of defending and glorifying the dignity and honor of a nation to firmly maintain independence. 
					
					 In order to achieve the independence of the popular masses it is also important for each country to exercise sovereignty with an attitude of being a master towards its own revolution and respect the sovereignty of other countries. 
					
					 It is a wanton violation of sovereignty for the imperialists to reject or try to stamp out the ideal, lifestyle and system of other countries and nations simply because they are not to their liking. 
					
					 Today the imperialists unreasonably pressurize and threaten those countries which refuse to meet their unjust demands or oppose them and try to stifle them by force of arms. 
					
					 They, indifferent to the rules and orders to be observed between countries, violate the international relations and orders to meet their own interests, throwing them into confusion. These reckless acts should never be tolerated. 
					
					 The Korean people will as ever unite with the world progressives and wage a dynamic struggle to maintain independence under the uplifted banner of Songun, the banner of independence.

articles.title: Professor at US University Terms "Northern Limit Line" Illegal
articles.content:
Professor at US University Terms "Northern Limit Line" Illegal
						
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- So Jae Jong, a professor at a U.S. university, on March 23 dedicated an article to an internet paper in which he termed the "Northern Limit Line" claimed by the south Korean authorities illegal. 
					 According to the article, a confidential document on the West Sea of Korea worked out by the CIA in January, 1974 said that the purpose of fixing the said line was to ban the sailing of south Korean boats towards the north beyond that line without special permissions in a bid to prevent accidents.
					
					 But the original purpose of the line has now disappeared and only such expressions as "preparations for prompt strikes" and "preemptive measures" are widely used, causing this line to serve as the root cause of military conflicts and seeds of fire that may throw the whole of the Korean Peninsula into a war disaster. 
					
					 Last year a U.S. aircraft carrier entered the waters around the line under the pretext of the warship sinking case, leading the situation to brink of a new world war. 
					
					 It was clearly written in the document of the CIA that the said line ran across the waters regarded as the territorial waters of the north. This means that already at that time there was a warning that this line might breed seeds of dispute, the article held.

articles.title: Organism Living in East Sea Only Found on "Torpedo No.1"
articles.content:
Organism Living in East Sea Only Found on "Torpedo No.1"
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- An organism living in the East Sea of Korea only was found on "torpedo No.1" which the south Korean authorities produced as critical evidence proving the warship "Cheonan" sinking case.
					 The south Korean internet broadcasting service "Voice of People" said this on March 26.
					
					 According to it, the above-said fact was confirmed by a photograph of the propelling body of the torpedo taken on November 7 last year which showed an organism stuck on a part of the screw.
					
					 After making an analysis of the photograph, a seafood cultivator said that the organism is a species of crabs living in the East Sea only, adding that such thing could be found in about November, the season for spawning, in the light of its size and condition. 
					
					 A professor at a fisheries college confirmed it. 
					
					 Sin Sang Chol, former member of the "civilian-army joint investigation team," after making public this photograph, asserted that this testifies to the fact that the above-said torpedo had nothing to do with the sinking of the warship "Cheonan". 
					
					 Noting that he made public the photograph to let people know about part of the truth behind the "Cheonan" case as some media have falsified facts on the lapse of one year since the occurrence of the case, he declared he would make public another species of sea organism.

articles.title: Large Naval Maneuvers Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Large Naval Maneuvers Staged in S. Korea
						
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet navy staged three day-long large naval maneuvers in the East, West and South seas of Korea from March 25 on the lapse of one year since the occurrence of the warship "Cheonan" sinking case, according to the south Korean KBS.
					The warmongers were busy with madcap drills for naval offensive and defensive battles, naval bombardment exercises, etc. with all forces of the navy including at least 30 warships, marine patrol planes and helicopters involved. 
					
					At night on March 26, in particular, they simultaneously staged anti-submarine exercises including the drill for dropping depth bombs in all waters, stoking a war atmosphere.

articles.title: US Helicopter Crashes in S. Korea
articles.content:
US Helicopter Crashes in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A helicopter of the U.S. army crashed into a farm field in the area around Juchon-myon, Jinan County, North Jolla Province of south Korea, on March 25, according to the south Korean MBC.
					 It was involved in the joint military exercises with the south Korean puppet army.

articles.title: Struggle against Layoff Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle against Layoff Urged in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A rally was held in Seoul on March 25 by the All-People Committee for Getting Layoff Repealed and Honoring the Memory of Victims in south Korea, which groups more than 70 political parties and civic and religious organizations.
					 Speakers at the rally noted that suicide of workers, fired by businesses under the unreasonable layoff system, is on a steady increase.
					
					 They deplored that only layoff is waiting for the workers working hard to support their families. 
					
					 They called for staging a struggle in unity to punish the present "government" driving the workers to death. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the Committee has held a candle-light rally in Seoul every evening from March 8 in demand of the repeal of the anti-popular labor policy.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Campaign Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Campaign Protested in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Inhabitants in Taema-ri, Cholwon County, Kangwon Province of south Korea, deterred the diehard conservatives from scattering anti-DPRK leaflets in the frontline area on March 26, according to the south Korean CBS.
					That day the People's Action Headquarters, an ultra-rightist conservative organization, attempted to scatter 6 million leaflets slandering the DPRK on the lapse of one year since the case of warship "Cheonan".
					
					The angry inhabitants blocked the entrance of their village with tractors and lorries and bravely fought against the conservatives.

articles.title: DPRK's Relief Fund Conveyed to Japan Red Cross Society
articles.content:
DPRK's Relief Fund Conveyed to Japan Red Cross Society 
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Relief fund was sent by the C.C., the DPRK Red Cross Society to the victims and bereaved families as regards the recent megaquake and tsunami that hit Japan, causing heavy human and material losses. The fund was conveyed by Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), to the chairman of the Japan Red Cross Society on Mar. 25.
					 Handing the fund, Ho expressed deep sympathy and condolences over the huge human and material losses caused by the devastating quake.
					
					 He said that the C.C., the DPRK Red Cross Society sent the relief fund to the Japanese victims on the basis of noble humanitarianism regardless of political and diplomatic issues.
					
					 He hoped that the DPRK and Japan would boost cooperation and exchange at the Red Cross level. 
					
					 The chairman of the Japan Red Cross Society expressed deep thanks to the DPRK for sending the relief fund despite the fact that the Japan-DPRK relations remain complicated and it is hard pressed for building an economic power.
					
					 Ho later had a press conference at the Korean Hall in Tokyo.
					
					He referred to the fact that General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent out of his loving care relief fund to the Korean victims in Japan.
					
					 The relief fund would be shared out not only among compatriots under Chongryon but among all other Korean victims, he said.
					
					 After the killer quake hit Japan, Chongryon formed an emergency measure committee and has since taken necessary measures such as positive aid activities not only for Korean victims but for Japanese ones, he noted.
					
					 Chongryon will join the Japanese people in the efforts to eradicate the aftermath of the quake, he stressed.

articles.title: Int'l Body Slashes at Anti-DPRK Moves by US and S. Korea
articles.content:
Int'l Body Slashes at Anti-DPRK Moves by US and S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The World Federation of Democratic Youth bitterly censured the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for their intensified moves of aggression on the DPRK.
					 In a political report adopted at the meeting of its General Council held in Brazil from Mar. 17 to 20, the Federation said:
					
					 The Federation expresses deep concern at the fact that the inter-Korean relations were brought to total collapse and a grave situation in which a nuclear war may break out anytime is prevailing again on the Korean Peninsula due to the U.S. and south Korean authorities' unprecedented moves for confrontation with the DPRK. 
					
					 Scathingly condemning the U.S. anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK, it strongly demands that the U.S. unconditionally stop the war exercises for aggression bringing the dark clouds of nuclear war to the peninsula and withdraw its troops and war equipment from south Korea at once.
					
					 A 2011 action plan was adopted at the meeting. The plan called for supporting the Korean people's cause of national reunification and intensifying the solidarity activities against the anti-DPRK war moves by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers with the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle as occasions.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Reported by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Reported by British Organization
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on March 23 posted on its Internet website "With the Century", the reminiscences of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Posted were "My Father and the Korean National Association" and "The Inheritance" in Chapter 1 from the first volume of Part 1 The Anti-Japanese Revolution of the reminiscences.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Mexican Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Mexican Organization
						
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism released the 53rd issue of its bulletin on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The bulletin carried his portrait and an article titled "Politician with human love".
					
					 The article said that Kim Il Sung, the father of socialist Korea, regarded the politics as embodiment of love and trust in the people and translated it into reality for the first time in the human history.
					
					 He founded the Juche idea and ushered in a new history of human love in the history of world politics, it noted, adding:
					
					 It is hard to fathom the breadth and depth of his politics of human love.
					
					 He regarded it as his noble obligation to well bring up descendents of his comrades.
					
					 His world of human love went beyond the boundaries.
					
					 You can find anywhere of the planet those revering him as the sun with warm human love.
					
					  He is the paramount incarnation of human love, the great man who governed the whole world with benevolence.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Costa Rica
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Costa Rica 
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Humberto Vargas Carbonel, general secretary of the People's Vanguard of Costa Rica, issued a statement on March 18 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The revolutionary parties and progressive people of the world desirous of socialism are significantly commemorating the birthday of the President as common holiday of mankind, the statement said.   
					
					 Praising him as the great model of people's leader, it said:
					
					 He showed warm benevolence for political and public personages of different countries in his lifetime.
					
					 That is why the world people have boundlessly revered him as the sun for all people and the tender-hearted father.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il is steering the general offensive of the Workers' Party and people of Korea to materialize Kim Il Sung's desire for building a rich and powerful country.
					
					  We are convinced that under his Songun leadership the WPK and the Korean people will greet the centenary of the President's birth as the greatest holiday of Kim Il Sung's nation and as a great auspicious event in human history.

articles.title: Singapore Halts Food Imports from Japan
articles.content:
Singapore Halts Food Imports from Japan
						
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Singapore recently took the measure of halting food imports from Japan's radiation-affected areas.
					 It has suspended with immediate effect the import of milk and milk products, fruits and vegetables, seafood and meat from radiation-affected prefectures such as Fukushima, Ibaraki, Tochigi and Gunma prefectures. 
					
					 The government of Singapore declared that this will be a "precautionary measure" in light of recent developments in Japan.

articles.title: Quake Rocks Sumatra, Indonesia
articles.content:
Quake Rocks Sumatra, Indonesia
						
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- An earthquake with 5.5 magnitude hit Sumatra island of Indonesia on Friday.
					 Its epicenter was 46 km southwest Padang Sidempuan of North Sumatra ad a depth of 80 km.

articles.title: Cuba Launches National Campaign against Vandalism
articles.content:
Cuba Launches National Campaign against Vandalism
						
 Havana, March 27 (KCNA) -- The Cuban Committees for the Defense of the Revolution (CDRs) on Mar. 23 started a nationwide campaign against vandalization of public properties.
					 During the campaign, discussions will be held in some affected districts on how to deal with the problem.
					
					 The national coordinator of the CDRs said that the actions against the public telephone and transportation systems endanger human life, affect the country's economy and hurt the public peace.

articles.title: Caribbean Countries Establish Regional Energy Policy
articles.content:
Caribbean Countries Establish Regional Energy Policy 
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Member countries of the Caribbean Community are working for regional energy policy.
					 A project approved Thursday by regional energy ministers during a session of the Council for Trade and Economic Development of established energy policy for regulating prices and ensuring the regional oil supply in connection with the rise of price in world fuel market.
					
					 The project also seeks to ensure regional cooperation mechanisms to maintain stable fuel prices.

articles.title: WTO Rules against US in Orange Juice Dispute with Brazil
articles.content:
WTO Rules against US in Orange Juice Dispute with Brazil
						
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The World Trade Organization said in its final report on Mar. 25 that the U.S. anti-dumping duties on imports of Brazilian orange juice violated international trade rules.
					 The United States imposed up to 60 percent of tariff on Brazilian orange juice.

articles.title: Oldest Stone-age Tools Discovered in India
articles.content:
Oldest Stone-age Tools Discovered in India
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Archaeologists have recently discovered India's oldest stone-age tools, up to 1.5 million years old, at a pre-historic site near Chennai, southern India.
					It was reported that it would help to study on the domiciliation activities of human ancestors, their modes of living and others.

articles.title: Sesionado contacto de trabajo N-S para investigacion conjunta
articles.content:
Sesionado contacto de trabajo N-S para investigacion conjunta
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 29 en Munsan del Sur de Corea el contacto de trabajo Norte-Sur para discutir la investigacion conjunta del volcan del monte Paektu.
					  Ambas partes coincidieron en la necesidad del estudio conjunto de las actividades volcanicas en el monte Paektu y acordaron cooperar activamente y seguir consultando en detalles los problemas correspondientes.
					
					  Ademas, decidieron sostener a principios de abril el proximo contacto de trabajo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente de Myanmar
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente de Myanmar 
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ATCC) -- En relacion con que Myanmar sufrio perdidas humanas y materiales por el reciente terremoto, Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio la vispera un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de ese pais, Thein Sein.
					En la misiva, el remitente manifesto profunda compasion y condolencias a los habitantes de la zona damnificada y a los familiares de victimas, y expuso su conviccion de que el presidente y el gobierno de Myanmar eliminaran cuanto antes  las secuelas de desastre natural y estabilizaran la vida de los damnificados.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim destaca necesidad de desarrollar ciencias agricolas
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim destaca necesidad de desarrollar ciencias agricolas
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ATCC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Yong Rim, estudio el dia 25 en el terreno el trabajo de la Academia de Ciencias Agricolas.
					Luego de recorrer la Exposicion Permanente de Ciencias Agricolas y otros lugares, Choe organizo la reunion consultiva de los funcionarios de la rama relacionada.
					
					En la ocasion se subrayo extraordinariamente que para producir gran renovacion en la produccion agricola segun el proposito del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, es preciso priorizar el desarrollo de las ciencias y tecnicas agricolas.
					
					Ademas, fueron discutidos los problemas para criar muchas variedades de alto rendimiento convenientes al clima y las condiciones de tierra de Corea y tomadas las medidas para garantizar suficientes condiciones de trabajo a los cientificos e investigadores.
					
					El mismo dia, el premier recorrio el Centro de Natacion del Reparto Chongchun y consulto los asuntos que se presentan para mejorar su cuidado y administracion.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop se reune con L. Purevsuren
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop se reune con L. Purevsuren
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ATCC) -- El vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Yang Hyong Sop, departio este martes en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con L. Purevsuren, enviado especial del mandatario de Mongolia y asesor del presidente para la Politica Exterior, y su comitiva, quien le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Ho Jong Man traslada fondos de consuelo a la SCR de Japon
articles.content:
Ho Jong Man traslada fondos de consuelo a la SCR de Japon 
						
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ATCC) -- Ho Jong Man, vicepresidente responsable del Presidium del Comite Central de la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon (Chongryon), traslado el dia 25 al presidente de la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja de Japon los fondos de consuelo que envio el Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea a las victimas y sus familiares con respecto a que hubo grandes perdidas humanas y materiales por el gran terremoto y el tsunami ocurridos en Japon. 
					En la ocasion, Ho expreso profunda compasion y pesar por esos danos. 
					
					El CC de la ACR de la RPDC envio fondos de consuelo a los damnificados japoneses en el noble espiritu humanitario y por encima de los problemas politicos y diplomaticos, dijo el.
					
					Deseo que en lo adelante, la RPDC y Japon fortalezcan la cooperacion y el intercambio en el nivel de Cruz Roja.
					
					El presidente de la SCR de Japon expuso profundo agradecimiento por los fondos enviados por Corea, pese a que se mantienen complicadas las relaciones bilaterales y ella esta ocupada por construir una potencia economica. 
					
					Acto seguido, Ho Jong Man concedio una conferencia de prensa en la Casa Coreana en Tokio.
					
					Dijo que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio a los compatriotas damnificados el dinero de consuelo que se distribuira no solo a los integrantes de la Chongryon sino a todos los consanguineos damnificados.
					
					Despues del gran terremoto, la Chongryon organizo el comite de auxilio urgente y tomo medidas necesarias incluso el socorro a los compatriotas y los japoneses afectados, menciono. 
					
					Expreso la decision de unir las fuerzas con la poblacion japonesa en la recuperacion de danos.

articles.title: FMJD denuncia maniobras anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
articles.content:
FMJD denuncia maniobras anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 29 de marzo (ATCC) -- La reunion del Consejo General de la Federacion Mundial de la Juventud Democratica, efectuada del dia 17 al 20 en Brasil, denuncio severamente las cada dia mas abiertas maniobras agresivas de Estados Unidos y las autoridades surcoreanas contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					El informe politico aprobado en el foro senalo que la FMJD expresa gran preocupacion de que debido a las maniobras conflictivas anti-RPDC sin precedentes de EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas, las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas se encuentran en el fracaso total y se crea otra vez en la Peninsula Coreana la grave situacion que pueda convertirse en una guerra nuclear en cualquier momento.
					
					La FMJD denuncia severamente la anacronica politica hostil a Corea de EE.UU. y demanda fuertemente a EE.UU. cesar incondicionalmente los ejercicios belicos que acarrean el nubarron de guerra nuclear a la Peninsula Coreana y retirar sin demora a sus efectivos y pertrechos belicos del suelo surcoreano, asevera el texto. 
					
					El plan de accion para 2011 aprobado en la reunion subrayo la necesidad de dinamizar las actividades solidarias con la causa del pueblo coreano por la reunificacion de la patria y contra las maniobras belicas anti-RPDC de los imperialistas norteamericanos y los belicistas titeres surcoreanos, con motivo del 11o aniversario de publicacion de la Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur del 15 de Junio y del mes de lucha conjunta antiyanqui 25 de junio-27 de julio.
